column2: UT DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Utah
column6: UT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column10: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

column2: 2. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column6: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.
column8: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.

column2: 3. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column6: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column8: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column10: stare straight ahead at all times.

column2: 4. When entering a crowded freeway, to merge into traffic you should:
column4: check your blind spots.
column6: use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to the same speed as freeway traffic.
column8: yield to vehicles already on the freeway.

column2: 5. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: switch to daytime lights.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column10: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

column2: 6. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 7. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column6: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column8: speed up to beat the train.

column2: 8. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: keep your eyes moving.
column6: be ready to react to road hazards.
column8: stay alert.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column6: Stay on the main highway if possible
column8: Detour to the right

column2: 10. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: stop in the right lane.
column6: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column8: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 11. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: rideplaning.
column6: pavement-planing.
column8: hydroplaning.

column2: 12. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: hill
column6: truck
column8: soft shoulder

column2: 13. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column6: “Y” intersection ahead
column8: The road ends ahead

column2: 15. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column6: your own reaction time.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 16. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors need to be adjusted.
column6: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 17. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column6: stop if necessary.
column8: go to work.

column2: 18. When driving in fog:
column4: drive the speed limit.
column6: do not drive over 10 MPH.
column8: turn on your low beams.

column2: 19. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: having them checked by a mechanic.
column6: riding the pedal lightly.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: The road ends ahead
column6: No Passing Zone
column8: One-way street

column2: 21. Railroad crossings should always be considered:
column4: safe when railroad crossing lights are active.
column6: safe to cross.
column8: a place where stopping is required.

column2: 22. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: one hour.
column6: 10 minutes.
column8: 3 hours.

column2: 23. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column6: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column8: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.

column2: 24. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column4: Speed limit
column6: School zone
column8: Stop

column2: 25. When driving through a curve, you should:
column4: stay near the right of your lane.
column6: slow as you enter, speed up as you exit.
column8: speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.
